source: Web research + public records + known commercial properties
notes: Decision makers: Property Managers, Building Managers, Facility Directors, Office Managers. Commercial buildings have captive audience during work hours. Target buildings with 200+ employees or multiple tenants. Break rooms and lobbies are primary vending locations.

prospects.address: 3960 Howard Hughes Pkwy, Las Vegas, NV 89169
prospects.notes: Major office park near the Strip. Multiple buildings, multiple tenants (law firms, financial services, tech). Howard Hughes Corp is a major developer. Massive daytime population = high vending volume. Each building needs machines.

prospects.address: 9205 W Russell Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89148
prospects.notes: Southwest Las Vegas mixed-use development. LaPour is a prominent local developer. Mix of office and retail tenants. Break rooms in office suites + common areas. Growing southwest corridor.

Henderson's premier corporate office park. American Nevada Company is one of the oldest and most respected developers in Southern Nevada (Greenspun family). Multiple buildings = multiple vending locations. Professional tenants = premium products.

prospects.address: 1000 N Green Valley Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89074
prospects.notes: Second American Nevada property. Green Valley Pkwy corridor. Bundle with Green Valley Corporate Center for portfolio deal. Established office complex with long-term tenants.

prospects.company: City of Henderson City Hall Complex
prospects.notes: Government building = formal bid process but stable long-term contract. City employees + public visitors. Multiple departments across several buildings. Government contracts are sticky - once you're in, you stay. Check for upcoming RFPs on cityofhenderson.com.

prospects.address: 495 S Main St, Las Vegas, NV 89101
prospects.notes: Major government complex downtown. Adjacent to Regional Justice Center and other government buildings. Public bid process. Large captive workforce. Government vending contracts = stable revenue. Check lasvegasnevada.gov for procurement opportunities.

prospects.company: The District at Green Valley Ranch
prospects.notes: Henderson's premier open-air lifestyle center. Third American Nevada property. High foot traffic. Office space above retail = daytime vending demand. Outdoor vending stations could work for evening/weekend shoppers.

prospects.address: 1980 Festival Plaza Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89135
prospects.notes: Premier office tower in Downtown Summerlin. Second Howard Hughes property - bundle deal with Hughes Center. Adjacent to Downtown Summerlin retail. Upscale tenants = premium healthy vending products.

prospects.address: 7251 W Lake Mead Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89128
prospects.notes: Colliers is a major global commercial RE firm. Multiple buildings in park. Mix of office and flex space tenants. Each building may need separate vending arrangements. Colliers manages many Las Vegas properties - relationship = pipeline.

prospects.address: 500 S Grand Central Pkwy, Las Vegas, NV 89106
prospects.contact_title: Director of Real Property Management / Purchasing
prospects.notes: Massive government complex. County employees + huge public visitor volume (DMV, marriage licenses, permits). Multiple buildings including amphitheater. Government procurement process required. Check ClarkCountyNV.gov for bid opportunities.

prospects.management_company: City of Henderson / Multiple Private Tenants
prospects.notes: Business aviation hub with surrounding office park. Pilots, FBO staff, business tenants. Terminal building needs vending. Growing area with new development. Unique aviation-focused clientele.

Henderson's downtown revitalization district. Mix of new office, retail, restaurants, entertainment. Growing rapidly with new construction. Multiple individual property owners = multiple conversations. City of Henderson is driving development.

Medical campus adjacent to Henderson Hospital. Medical offices, wellness centers, retail. Healthcare workers + patients = high vending demand. Adjacent to Henderson Hospital = can pitch both simultaneously. Growing campus with new construction.

UNLV School of Medicine campus in the medical district. Students + faculty + staff = young, tech-savvy demographic. State entity = procurement process. Near UMC = medical district vending network potential.

prospects.address: 1460 W Horizon Ridge Pkwy, Henderson, NV 89012
prospects.notes: Commercial heart of Cadence master-planned community. Rapidly growing Henderson neighborhood. New construction = modern tenant improvements. Mix of medical, professional, retail tenants. LandWell is the developer of Cadence community.

outreach_strategy.step1: Identify the property management company for each building (some have multiple tenants who each decide)
outreach_strategy.step2: For government buildings, check procurement websites for active vending RFPs/RFQs
outreach_strategy.step3: For private buildings, contact Building Manager or Property Manager directly
outreach_strategy.step4: Offer trial placement (1 machine, 30 days) to prove revenue potential
outreach_strategy.step5: Use revenue data from trial to pitch expansion across property manager's portfolio
outreach_strategy.pitch_angle: Zero cost, modern cashless machines, monthly commission, fresh healthy options for employee wellness, 24/7 restocking service

key_relationships.american_nevada_company: 3 properties in Henderson - single relationship could yield 3+ locations
key_relationships.howard_hughes_corp: 2 major office developments - premium locations, premium products
key_relationships.government_entities: Clark County + City of Henderson + City of Las Vegas = long sales cycle but sticky contracts
